types.section:
{{fr-adj}}

# {{lb|fr|obsolete}} In mathematics, qualifies a number that is composed of a columnar number and a pyramidal one, such that the side of the first is larger than that of the second by one
types.html:
pyrgoïdal (feminine pyrgoïdale, masculine plural pyrgoïdaux, feminine plural pyrgoïdales)

  1. (obsolete) In mathematics, qualifies a number that is composed of a columnar number and a pyramidal one, such that the side of the first is larger than that of the second by one
trans: In mathematics, qualifies a number that is composed of a columnar number and a pyramidal one, such that the side of the first is larger than that of the second by one
